clinical_study.brief_title: Randomized Controlled Trial of a Novel Laser-aided Orthodontic-periodontal Treatment Strategy
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Controlled Trial of a Novel Laser-aided Orthodontic-periodontal Treatment Strategy

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of the study is to assess the effects of low-level laser therapy (LLLT) in patients with periodontitis during orthodontic-periodontal treatment for 12 months on the following aspects: (1) Effects on periodontal status; (2) Effects on alveolar bone remodeling; (3) Effects on cervical dentin sensitivity; (4) Effects on pain and quality of life.
To eliminate any bias, the investigators will initially hypothesize that there is no difference in periodontal status, jawbone remodeling, tooth sensitivity, pain and quality of life in patients having teeth with chronic periodontitis and receiving LLLT with orthodontic treatment versus teeth undergoing orthodontic treatment without incorporation of LLLT.

detailed_description.textblock: On the basis of the investigators' pilot study results, 35 patients with chronic periodontitis will be recruited and initially treated for inflammation. Using a randomized split-mouth design,the teeth in experimental (laser) group will receive LLLT while the teeth in the control (placebo) group will receive no laser treatment. The effects of LLLT in orthodontic-periodontal treatment on periodontal inflammation control, jawbone remodeling, reduction of tooth sensitivity, pain relief and quality of life will be investigated.

primary_outcome.measure: inflammatory cytokine levels in the gingival cervical fluid

arm_group.description: LLLT group: orthodontic treatment and low-level laser therapy
Control group: orthodontic treatment and no laser treatment.

intervention.description: The test teeth will receive LLLT using a 940 nanometer diode laser (EZLASE; BIOLASE Technology Inc., Irvine, CA, USA) with output power of 330 milliwatt. The experimental side was irradiated for 30 s in two sessions, delivering an energy density of 7 Joules per square centimeter.

Orthodontic treatment will be carried out using preadjusted appliances with bonded 0.022Ã—0.028-square inch brackets/buccal tubes and 0.014-inch NiTi archwires as the first archwires. The treatment or the major part of the treatment will be completed in 12 months.
